Package net.kemitix.mon.combinator

Interface After<T,​R>

Type Parameters:
T - the argument type
R - the result type
All Superinterfaces:
Function<Function<T,​R>,​Function<BiConsumer<T,​R>,​Function<T,​R>>>
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface After<T,​R> extends Function<Function<T,​R>,​Function<BiConsumer<T,​R>,​Function<T,​R>>>
After pattern combinator.

Original from http://boundsofjava.com/newsletter/003-introducing-combinators-part1

Author:
Federico Peralta Schaffner (fps@boundsofjava.com)

  • Method Details

    • decorate

      static <T,​ R> Function<T,​R> decorate​(Function<T,​R> function, BiConsumer<T,​R> after)
      Decorates a function with a Consumer that will be supplier with the argument before applying it to the function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the argument type
      R - the result type
      Parameters:
      function - the function to apply the argument to and return the result value of
      after - the bi-consumer that will receive the argument and the result of the function
      Returns:
      a partially applied Function that will take an argument and return the result of applying it to the function parameter

    • create

      static <T,​ R> After<T,​R> create()
      Create an After curried function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the argument type
      R - the result type
      Returns:
      a curried function that will pass the argument and the result of the function to the supplied bi-consumer
